metadata.titleEn: Whole-rock geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data of Cambrian granitoids in the West Kunlun
metadata.description: This data includes the main trace geochemistry and Sr-Nd isotope data of the whole rock. The samples were collected from four rock bodies in the West Kunlun Pamir area. The main geochemical data of the whole rock are obtained by X-ray fluorescence spectrometer, the trace elements are obtained by inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer, and the Sr-Nd isotopic data of the whole rock are obtained by multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer. Through the obtained data, the magma source areas are defined as the mixing of Mesoproterozoic ancient basement rocks and juvenile crustal materials, the mixing of meta-igneous rocks, and meta-sedimentary rocks, and Mesoproterozoic ancient basement rocks, which help understand regional magmatism and tectonic evolution.
metadata.instructions: All data is stored in an Excel file and can be opened directly by Office. The file name is "WRMajTrSrNd" representing the major and trace elements and Sr-Nd isotope data of the whole rock.

literatureList.titleEn: Petrogenesis of Early Cambrian granitoids in the western Kunlun orogenic belt, Northwest Tibet: Insight into early stage subduction of the Proto-Tethys Ocean
literatureList.referenceEn: Yin, J.Y., Xiao, W.J., Sun, M., Chen, W., Yuan, C., Zhang, Y.Y., Wang, T., Du, Q.Y., Wang, X.S., Xia, X.P. (2020). Petrogenesis of Early Cambrian granitoids in the western Kunlun orogenic belt, Northwest Tibet: Insight into early stage subduction of the Proto-Tethys Ocean. Geological Society of America Bulletin, 132(9-10), 2221–2240.

Example.Question: Can you provide an example of a data collection method used to obtain whole-rock geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data from Cambrian granitoid rocks?
Example.Answer: A data collection method involves sampling from four plutons in the Western Kunlun-Pamir region, where whole-rock major geochemical data is obtained using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry, trace elements are analyzed through inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, and whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopic data is collected using multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the specific attributes and characteristics of geochemical and isotopic data collected from Cambrian granitoid rocks in the West Kunlun region?
Feature Specification.Answer: whole-rock major and trace element geochemistry, Sr-Nd isotopic data, X-ray fluorescence spectrometry, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry

Quantification.Question: How many rock samples were collected from the four rock bodies in the 西昆仑-帕米尔 region for geochemical and isotopic analysis?
Quantification.Answer: The field metadata does not specify the exact number of samples collected from the four rock bodies in the 西昆仑-帕米尔 region.

Interpretation.Question: What underlying geological processes can be inferred from the geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data patterns collected from granitic rocks in the West Kunlun-Pamir region?
Interpretation.Answer: The geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data suggest that the magma source regions are a mix of Middle Proterozoic ancient basement rocks and new crustal materials, as well as a combination of metamorphic igneous rocks and metamorphic sedimentary rocks. This information provides insights into the regional magmatic activity and tectonic evolution.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the underlying causes that lead to the need for using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry, inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry, and multicollector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry in collecting geochemical and isotopic data of granitoid rocks in the Western Kunlun region?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The need for using these advanced analytical techniques arises from the complexity and heterogeneity of granitoid rocks in the Western Kunlun region. X-ray fluorescence spectrometry is utilized to accurately determine the major elemental composition, while inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry is essential for obtaining precise trace element data. Multicollector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry is critical for precise Sr-Nd isotopic analysis, which helps in understanding the magma source and mixing processes involving ancient basement rocks and new crustal materials. These methods provide detailed insights into the magmatic activities and tectonic evolution of the region.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary goal of collecting whole-rock geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data from Cambrian granitic rocks in the West Kunlun region?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary goal of collecting whole-rock geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data is to delineate the magma source areas, which include a mixture of Mesoproterozoic ancient basement rocks and newly formed crustal materials, as well as metamorphosed igneous and sedimentary rocks. This data is crucial for understanding regional magmatism and tectonic evolution.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the instrumental and procedural steps involved in collecting and analyzing whole-rock geochemical and Sr-Nd isotopic data from Cambrian granitic rocks in the Western Kunlun region?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection process involves sampling rocks from four plutons in the Western Kunlun-Pamir region. Whole-rock major geochemical data is analyzed using X-ray fluorescence spectrometry (XRF), trace elements are obtained through inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (ICP-MS), and whole-rock Sr-Nd isotopic data is analyzed using multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC-ICP-MS). These methods are used to determine the magmatic source regions and understand the regional magmatic activity and tectonic evolution.
